p: Anopheles flavivirus (AnFV), the first flavivirus discovered in Anopheles, was identified in a population virome survey in Liberia and Senegal [ 32]. An RT-PCR diagnostic assay confirmed the presence of AnFV RNA in wild Anopheles, with a prevalence of 12%. Anopheles gambiae flavivirus (AngFV) and An. squamosus flavivirus (AnsFV) were detected in An. gambiae and An. squamosus respectively by a nucleic acid melting-curve analysis from mosquitoes collected in Kenya [ 34]. AngFVs and AnsFV share 77% of nucleotide identity.
